Trial_Design.evidence: A total of 70 pregnant women who previously qualified for elective cesarean section and enrolled in the study were divided into two groups.

Participants.evidence: A total of 70 pregnant women who previously qualified for elective cesarean section and enrolled in the study were divided into two groups.

Intervention.evidence: The oxytocin group (OXY) received 5 IU of oxytocin intravenously (i.v.). The carbetocin group (CARBE) received 100 µg of carbetocin intravenously.

Objective.evidence: The choice of the appropriate dose of oxytocin or carbetocin should take into account potential cardiovascular effects.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Continuous Holter electrocardiograph recording started 30 min before the procedure and continued until about 3 h after the procedure.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 70 pregnant women who previously qualified for elective cesarean section and enrolled in the study were divided into two groups.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of ST-segment-lowering episodes, the depth of the denivelation and its duration did not differ between the groups studied.

Harms.evidence: No abnormalities were observed in either of the analyzed groups during intraoperative ECG recordings at either the highest or lowest recorded heart rate values.
